_header: To Gods worship that dear us bought
Note: For other MSS which lack the introductory stanza see 3207; for the 51st Psalm occurring separately see 3481.
Subjects: psalms, penitential; scripture texts, paraphrases; paraphrases
_description: Maydestone’s version of the Seven Penitential Psalms — in 8-line stanzas (abababab)

BodDig18.First Lines:
TO goddis worschipe þat dere us bouȝteTo whom we owen to
                    make oure mone…
BodDig18.Last Lines:
…In heueuen (sic) kyngdom me to ceesenGraunte us oo god &
                    persones þre
BodDig18.Note: Every stanza is introduced by Latin first lines of psalms.
BodDig18.Attributed Title:
Here bigynneþ þe prologe of þe seuene salmys in englysche by
                    Richard hampole heremyte (f. 38)
BodDig18.Editions:
Adler,  Guido,  and  M. Kaluza.  
             “über die Richard Rolle de Hampole zugeschriebene Paraphrase der
                sieben Busspsalmen.” 
             Englische Studien
         10 (1887): 215-55: 232-55 (collated with Oxford,  Bodleian Library Eng. poet. e.17 (SC 32690) and
                            Oxford,  Bodleian Library Digby 102 (SC 1703) (3207 [2]).

BodLauMis174.First Lines:
TO goddis worchip þat dere vs bouȝtTo whom we owen to
                    make our mone…
BodLauMis174.Last Lines:
…In heuen kyngdom me to seysenGraunt vs oo god & persones
                    þre
BodLauMis174.Attributed Title:
Here begynyn þe seuen psalmes (f. 1), Here endyn þe vij spalmes
                    (at the end)

BodRawA389.First Lines:
To goddes worshepe þat vs dere bouȝteTo whom we owe to
                    make oure moon…
BodRawA389.Last Lines:
…In heuen kyndome me to seesenGraunte þou god and
                    persones þre
BodRawA389.Editions:
Edden,  Valerie. 
             Richard Maidstone’s Penitential Psalms.
Middle English Texts
         21. Heidelberg: Universitätsverlag/Carl Winter,
            1990.

BodEngPoete17.First Lines:
To suffre sorwe & stormes strongffor syþen Adam þe
                    lawe lete…
BodEngPoete17.Last Lines:
…[ ]neþ to euery wiȝte[ ]shal seen and goostly
                    knowen…
BodEngPoete17.Note: Fragments of four folios damaged and partly unreadable.

RylandsEng51.First Lines:
To goddes worschipe þat dere vs bouȝtTo whom we owen to
                    make oure moneOf oure synnes þat we han wrouȝtIn
                    ȝouþe & elde wel many one…
RylandsEng51.Last Lines:
…In heuene kyngdome me to sesenGraunte oon god & persones
                    þre
RylandsEng51.Attributed Title:
Explicit comentum super 7 psalmos penitentiales in Anglicis (f.
                        134v)

PhilUPEng1.First Lines:
…Whan bodiis stinkyn vndir þe stonWhere þe sowlis
                    ben no wyth can telle…
PhilUPEng1.Last Lines:
…In heuene kyngdom me to seseGraunte on god and personys
                    thre
PhilUPEng1.Note:
Imperfect at beginning due to loss of folio(s) at front of
                    volume.
